channel.title: Discret Choice Modelling on Discret Choice Modelling Lesson
channel.description: Recent content in Discret Choice Modelling on Discret Choice Modelling Lesson

item.description: Welcome This is the welcome page You find here lesson materials description and abstract links to the Caseine Platform use of the posts description of the evaluation references and other things… Lessons planning Each lesson is described as follows Lesson Duration Topic Activities Lesson 1 3 hours Introduction: DCM with R Lesson: DCM overview Exercise: reminder of R and Rmarkdown applied to Categorical variables statistical tests Lesson 2 3 hours Binary logistic Regression Lesson: Linear Probability model Logistic regression specification Estimation and inference Exercise: Effect of PSI Lesson 3 3 hours Guided work: Binary Logistic Regression Exercise: Death Penalty ; Binary Women role ; Titanic survival rate Lesson 4 3 hours Project Presentation Discussion on the project and the raised difficulties Lesson 5 3 hours Discret Choice Model (RUM) Lesson: Discret Choice in Microeconomics Probabilistic Discret choice Binary choice Model Economic Outputs in DCM Exercise: Transport mode choice Lesson 6 3 hours Multiple choice Model Lesson: Multinomial Logit model ; Specification and estimation ; IIA assumption Exercise: Transport mode choice Lesson 7 3 hours Discrete Choice Model Extensions Lesson: Exercise: Ordered Logit on Wallet data ; Nested logit in transport Lesson 8 3 hours Project Defense Student defense of their final project Posts Posts will be used to manage the contact (prof \(\rightarrow\) student), as notification during the semester

item.title: Introduction to Discret Choice Lesson
item.description: Introduction These Introduction slides present: Table of contents Introduction Program Motivations Importance of DCM Course Objectives General Context of Choice analysis Four broad frameworks Sample and Measurement Issues in Model Building R and Tests for Categorical Data Inference for a (Single) Proportion Two-Way Contingency Tables The Odds-Ratio Chi-Squared Tests of Independence Program 5 steps/lessons : • Introduction • Binary Choice • Multinomial Choices • Advanced Models : papers presentation (with application) • Discussion : papers discussion (reversed class) • Guided work sessions
